bug.author: ZijiaLewisLu
bug.description:
Hi, on tensorflow.org there is part of documentation accidentally formatted into code. It's not a serious problem. It's about initializer on r0.11. I didn't check if other versions have the same problem. Just want to post it here for your information. <denchmark-link:https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16264284/21070208/e29a628e-be4f-11e6-973e-e5a936a5f794.png></denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/state_ops.html#random_normal_initializer>link: https://www.tensorflow.org/versions/r0.11/api_docs/python/state_ops.html#random_normal_initializer</denchmark-link> (this actually won't lead you right to the location because of the error ).

comments.comment: This seems fixed at head. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/xmbrst>@xmbrst</denchmark-link> is this worth fixing in earlier versions?
looks OK in the new website. closing.
